title: Can I get banned for stating my opinion?
body:
Let's say that the whole chat is empty. No one has said anything about themselves or their preferences when it comes to sport or TV-Shows.

Will I get punished for saying the following, assuming no one in the game has said anything.

Example 1: I think anime is for losers.

If no one has said anything, how could I possibly be targeting/harrassing anyone / violating the rules? 

Example 2: I think basketball is for losers.

If no one has said that they are a basketball player or basketball fan, how could I possibly be targeting/harrasing someone / violating the rules?

This is a serious question :)


EDIT #1: I can see that anime fans are starting to downvote my post. That's kinda childish in my opinion, because this is a serious question.

replies.body:
This thread has pretty well run its course and been answered.  Since it's devolving into passive aggressive and insulting comments towards others of different opinions, I'm going to lock it down before it goes further.

If anyone has questions about this moderation action, don't hesitate to reach out to the Boards Moderation Team via:

* The [**NA Boards Discord**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation/7rtKBZLi-boards-moderation-discord-verification)
* The [**Discuss the Boards**](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/community-moderation) sub-board

{{sticker:poppy-wink}}

I think maybe that falls on a lower end of toxicity, but obviously it's being said to incite arguments and insult people randomly. If you do this frequently I would not be surprised if you were issued a punishment either by the system or through a manual review. If you think making general statements not directed at a person is a loophole to get away with being rude and starting fights, it's not as clever as you think.

"but obviously it's being said to incite arguments and insult people randomly" 

What makes you assume this? I'm not a toxic person. And I'm not intending to use this as a loophole to get away with being rude, wtf? Thanks for your answer tho, here's another question:

If the following line is the ONLY thing I say in the whole game, then how can I get punished?: "I think anime is for >insert non toxic noun< :)"

Now there is no way, that this is directely meant in a negative manner. So how can I possibly get punished for it?
It's the same thing as saying: Garen is for new players.

> "but obviously it's being said to incite arguments and insult people randomly"
> 
> What makes you assume this?

I can see what DTN means here. Randomly saying "x thing is for losers" is just meant to insult people who like whatever "x" is and incite arguments. It'd be like if I said "the 2018 VS Wolf Icons are for losers" - sure, it'd be a broad-strokes, general statement, but _you could easily see it as a pointed insult._

> If the following line is the ONLY thing I say in the whole game, then how can I get punished?: "I think anime is for >insert non toxic noun< :)"

Define "non-toxic noun".

> Now there is no way, that this is directely meant in a negative manner.

Except for the fact that you're using a word with largely negative connotations (loser) as a means to disparage the people of the group you're broadly referencing.

The fact that you're still trying to create a dozen different rationales to say it's not toxic makes it pretty clear that you are, despite your statements to the contrary, looking for loopholes to use to be rude.

> It's the same thing as saying: Garen is for new players.

There's a difference between subjective and objective information, and saying "x is for losers" (x being basketball, anime, whatever) is a great measure different from saying "Garen is a new-player-friendly Champion." The former is you insulting people based on what they like (be it basketball, anime, etc.), and the latter is commenting on Garen's kit being simple enough to use that newer players won't have much issue playing the game as him.

Dude, you're not reading what I'm typing...

"Except for the fact that you're using a word with largely negative connotations (loser) as a means to disparage the people of the group you're broadly referencing."

I didn't say loser, I said "non toxic noun". This could be things like carrot, racoon dog, banana etc. 

With that being said, everything you just wrote makes no sense.

> Dude, you're not reading what I'm typing...
>
> I didn't say loser...

Except, your OP still shows examples using the word "loser(s)".

> Example 1: I think anime is for losers.
>
> Example 2: I think basketball is for losers.

Since those are the only examples that you had, at the time, provided anything concrete for (because, again, you only said "insert non-toxic noun", didn't specify what that noun could be), those were the examples I was using for the sake of argument.

> This could be things like carrot, racoon dog, banana etc.

None of these make sense following the preceding argument of "x is for y", so being punished for gibberish is pretty unlikely.

Though, I wouldn't hazard "raccoon dog", since a manual review could come up with that being seen as a way to avoid directly using a racist slur.

> With that being said, everything you just wrote makes no sense.

Makes no sense to _you_. If you want me to clarify, feel free to ask, but making the assertion that what I'm saying makes no sense is pretty pointless.

"Except, your OP still shows examples using the word "loser(s)"

"Since those are the only examples that you had, at the time, provided anything concrete for (because, again, you only said "insert non-toxic noun", didn't specify what that noun could be), those were the examples I was using for the sake of argument."

As we're having a discussion, you're supposed to follow our conversation and not the original post, as I have clarified/changed a few things. 

I appreciate your time and I'm sorry if I offended you. 

Last question: "I don't mean to be offensive towards anyone, but in my personal opinion, anime is for carrots". Is this punishable or not? If yes, then why?

> Last question: "I don't mean to be offensive towards anyone, but in my personal opinion, anime is for carrots". Is this punishable or not? If yes, then why?

Outside of manual review, I can't imagine it would be, because as I had mentioned earlier, it's gibberish. That said, I would still avoid it, since manual review can come up with those ad-libbed nouns being seen as a way to avoid outright insulting people.

---

Additionally, I want to bring up your edit to the original post;

> EDIT #1: I can see that anime fans are starting to downvote my post. That's kinda childish in my opinion, because this is a serious question.

This is _exactly_ what Deep Terror Nami was talking about. Using the statement "anime is for losers" to stir up trouble, cause arguments, etc. - and now you're presuming that people who downvote your post are anime fans who took offense to your example, going even further to insult that group by calling them childish.

All that does is serve to try and dredge up arguments and controversy, and it's wholly irrelevant to your post. If it's a serious question, take it seriously, instead of trying to leverage in insults against a group that you presume to be against you.

Oh, and that edit was just me stating facts.
I encourage you to go review the definition of fact, as the edit is everything **but** fact.

> EDIT #1: I can see that anime fans are starting to downvote my post.

facts mean you can prove it.  Do you have forum administrative access to know WHO downvoted you and do you have the data to back up your assertion those people love anime?

Speculation =/= Fact.  You are clueless....

To make this easier for you, I'm going to use another example:

"I don't mean to be offensive towards anyone, but in my personal opinion, anime is for carrots". 

How is that toxic?

Still playing with fire. 

If you wanted to compliment a certain group of people, then use a proper compliment. Just becuase you exchange a toxic noun for something that is a neutral noun doesn't mean the intent of trying to insult someone  isn't there. 


As Umbral Regent mentioned, the automated system probably won't punish you, but it probably won't get past a manual review.

I would assume the context. I've not seen anyone mention anything remotely anime in the last 1000~ games, so if you randomly were to bring up something even pseudo controversial for controversy sake then you're guilty of being a negative influence if nothing else.

Disregarding whether it's toxic or not, it's completely irrelevant to the game at hand.
You queued to play a video game, not discuss what people like to watch in their free time. 
Probably better to keep your mouth shut if you have nothing useful to say, nobody asked for your opinion.
You are obviously trying to just find a way around being reportable while being actually toxic man. Say as you please but I'm nearly certain you are just trying to avoid punishment of toxicity
You are completely wrong. Stop assuming stuff. Thanks :)

There is no reason to state that in the middle of a match, other than to provoke or insult. Its directed at anime or basketball fans. So idk what you mean by its not targetted. Go ahead and play dumb though, idc.
Thats actually a decent point. Thanks for your answer!
You don't get punished for stating your opinion. You get punished for being a dick.
The more serious question is .. why are you trying to play with fire?
Are you born in a train? Stop answering with a weird question..
This is like pouring gasoline everywhere and then arguing that it's ok because "there are no open flames anywhere near it." I mean you're just asking for an explosion by doing that.
It can be.
What????? How??
As a loser who likes anime I can safely say OP is probably trolling

To answer the apparent question, yes, you certainly can get banned for stating an opinion. You can also get banned for factual statements, whether true or false. The key is whether you're being toxic, flaming, and/or harassing people. Dropping "anyone who likes [this popular thing] is a loser" into chat is obviously just meant to rile up anyone who likes that popular thing and turn chat into a flamefest for your amusement, which is rightfully punishable.

To answer your actual question, it's an interesting idea to try to come up with some pre-approved toxicity with a paper trail you can link to, but, if you got banned for such behavior, neither the IFS nor Riot support would care about this thread (even if anyone did agree with you here, which no one is).
And this is not negative behavior. If this is negative behavior, then saying that terrorism is for losers is negative behavior too.
And if you can't see the objective similarity here, then don't even comment. I don't care about your answer for obvious reasons :)
Nobody needs your permission to do a goddamn thing. Check that ego before we see you back in a month lamenting your permaban.
